codeSystems.name: DocumentEntryFormatCode
codeSystems.title: DocumentEntry.formatCode
codeSystems.description:
Document format as per Annex; EPRO-FDHA.
      		This unambiguous code defines the format of the XDS document. Together with the mimetype, this should provide the potential consumer with sufficient information as to whether they are in a position to process the document.

codeSystems.name: DocumentEntryHealthcareFacilityTypeCode
codeSystems.title: DocumentEntry.healthcareFacilityTypeCode
codeSystems.description:
Type of healthcare facility as per Annex 3; EPRO-FDHA.
      This code describes the type of healthcare facility in which the document was compiled during the treatment process. In conjunction with the authorisation control, the patient can use this information to assign all documents from a specific type of healthcare facility to a specific confidentiality level in their rights and attributes, for example.

codeSystems.name: DocumentEntryLanguageCode
codeSystems.title: DocumentEntry.languageCode
codeSystems.description: Document language as per Annex 3 EPRO-FDHA. Defines the language in which the document was written.

codeSystems.name: DocumentEntryMimeType
codeSystems.title: DocumentEntry.mimeType
codeSystems.description: MIME type of the document as per Annex; EPRO-FDHA.

codeSystems.name: DocumentEntryOriginalProviderRole
codeSystems.title: DocumentEntry.originalProviderRole
codeSystems.description: DocumentEntry.originalProviderRole

codeSystems.name: DocumentEntryPracticeSettingCode
codeSystems.title: DocumentEntry.practiceSettingCode
codeSystems.description:
Medical specialisation of the data captured in the document as per Annex 3; EPRO-FDHA.
      This attribute assigns the contents of a document to a medical specialisation. It is conceivable that this information will assist the patient with setting or changing the confidentiality level of documents, which is relevant for controlling access.

codeSystems.name: EprPurposeOfUse

codeSystems.description: Purpose Of Use as per Annex 5 EPRO-FDHA, Extension 1.
